description: Trichostasis Spinulosa is a common but often overlooked condition characterized by small, dark bumps on the skin caused by hair follicles that are blocked with trapped hairs.
symptoms: Tiny dark bumps on the skin, usually on the face or upper arms
Skin may feel rough or bumpy to the touch
treatments: Topical retinoids to help unclog hair follicles
Exfoliating scrubs to remove trapped hairs
Laser hair removal for long-term management
